text:
In the common calendar of [[Khorvaire]], days are 24 hours long, divided into day and night. Seven days make up a week, four weeks a month, and twelve months a year. The months correspond to the twelve [[moon]]s of [[Eberron]] (see the table below), and share their names. The seven days of the week, in order, are ''Sul'', ''Mol'', ''Zol'', ''Wir'', ''Zor'', ''Far'', ''Sar''. The common calendar of Khorvaire tracks the years since the founding of the kingdom of [[Galifar]], using the abbreviation YK. The last king of Galifar, [[Jarot ir'Wynarn]], died on 12 Therendor 894 YK. The Day of [[Mourning]] occurred a century later, on 20 Olarune 994 YK. By default, a new Eberron campaign begins on 1 Zarantyr 998 YK. See also [[Modern Age]], and [[lunar phases of Eberron]]. |!Month |!Name | | 1 |[[Zarantyr]] (mid-winter) | | 2 |[[Olarune]] (late winter) | | 3 |[[Therendor]] (early spring) | | 4 |[[Eyre]] (mid-spring) | | 5 |[[Dravago]] (late spring) | | 6 |[[Nymm]] (early summer) | | 7 |[[Lharvion]] (mid-summer) | | 8 |[[Barrakas]] (late summer) | | 9 |[[Rhaan]] (early autumn) | | 10 |[[Sypheros]] (mid-autumn) | | 11 |[[Aryth]] (late autumn) | | 12 |[[Vult]] (early winter) | !!
